intro: Acronychia foveata, commonly known as the rough-leaved acronychia, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its thick, rough-textured bark and elliptical, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in rainforests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
